result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Brusic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid along with payment plan on count 3.
With Huber. May transfer to Cook County, Illinois. Sentence credit of 25 days were granted.
Costs to be paid along with payment plan on count 3.

With Huber. May transfer to Cook County, Illinois. Sentence credit of 25 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Count 1
Fine and costs to be paid at $100.00 per month commencing 12/01/2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 26 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.

Perform Alcohol Assessment.

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. Surcharge is waived.

Defendant Steven A Brusic in court with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Dorlack makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. Defendant's mother makes a statement on his behalf. 

COUNT #1:
___ 30 DAYS HUBER (CONCURRENT TO COUNT #2) ***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO COOK COUNTY, ILLINOIS***
___COSTS:  $243.00

COUNT#2:
___ 30 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 25 days) (CONCURRENT TO COUNT #1) ***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO COOK COUNTY, ILLINOIS***
___COSTS:  $243.00

COUNT#3:
___FINE: $828.50
___DL REVOCATION: 6 months
___Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH

Total financial obligation is $1,314.50  (to be paid at $100/month commencing 12/01/16 or serve 26 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine)

Court waives the DNA Surcharge based on date of violation.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven A Brusic in court with Attorney Joseph James Dorlack.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  State files 2nd amended information.  State moves to orally amend Count #3 to OWI-1st (non-criminal).  Court grants.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 and 2 on 2nd amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to OWI-1st (formerly Count #3).  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 and 2.  Court finds Defendant guilty of OWI-st (formerly Count #3).   Attorney Dorlack requests a sentencing date.  Court addresses WCS letters/reports.  Court will remove WCS monitoring.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
